overview:
Wall was a founding member of the management team that started Intel’s storage business in the late 1990â€™s. In total, he spent 15 years at Intel, most recently as the general manager of the companyâ€™s Storage Group. He worked closely with the large, multinational OEMs that manufacture and distribute servers, workstations and storage solutions.

Prior to joining Intel, Wall served as a general manager at Cray Research, where he was responsible for North American operations. He has also held several marketing management positions at IBM Corporation.

Wall earned a Bachelor of Arts degree in economics at State University of New York at Stony Brook, as well as a Masters of Management Sciences from Harriman College for Urban and Policy Sciences at SUNY Stony Brook.

(Source: Nirvanix)
